datext

Class DaTextElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • datext.DaTextElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public abstract class DaTextElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This is the abstract superclass for all DaText components. It provides get and set methods for all possible subtypes, even if the underlying data doesn't match that type (throwing an UnsupportedOperationException). This is to simplify the use of this class instead of casting every element to the appropriate subtype.

    • Field Summary

      protected java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock readWriteLock
      Lock to synchronize reading and writing
      protected java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock.WriteLock writeLock
      All setter methods must use this lock (or their own Read/Write Lock) to be thread-safe

        This method is thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        newRoot - New root element

        This method is thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        newParent - New owning element

      • getElement

        public abstract DaTextElement getElement(java.lang.String key)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the child element by the given variable name, if it exists.

        Example:
        ex.dtx:
        numJellyBeans=273
        weight=158.052
        availableColors=[red,blue,yellow,green]
        # Properties of this batch of jelly beans
        properties={
           lotNumber=29474936
           texture=shiny
           flavor=fruity
           metadata=10 1F BE A2 50 00 22 3A FF
        }
        java code:
        DaTextElement docRoot = DaTextParser.parse(new File("ex.dtx"));
        long lot = docRoot.getElement("properties").getLong("lotNumber");
        System.out.println("Analyzing lot #" + lot);

        Parameters:
        key - Variable name that identifies the element being referenced.
        Returns:
        Returns a DaTextElement representing the indicated element, or null if no such element exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the indicated element is not an element type.

      • getList

        public abstract java.util.List<java.lang.String> getList(java.lang.String key)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets a field by the given field name, if it exists, and treats it as a list.

        Example:
        ex.dtx:
        numJellyBeans=273
        weight=158.052
        availableColors=[red,blue,yellow,green]
        # Properties of this batch of jelly beans
        properties={
           lotNumber=29474936
           texture=shiny
           flavor=fruity
           metadata=10 1F BE A2 50 00 22 3A FF
        }
        java code:
        DaTextElement docRoot = DaTextParser.parse(new File("ex.dtx"));
        List<String> colors = docRoot.getList("availableColors");
        System.out.println("Colors:");
        for(String color : colors){
          System.out.println("\t" + color);
        }

        Parameters:
        key - Variable name that identifies the element being referenced.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of Strings representing the indicated element, or null if no such element exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the indicated element is not a list type.

      • getInt

        public abstract int getInt(java.lang.String key)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Gets a field by the given field name, if it exists, and parses it as an integer.

        Example:
        ex.dtx:
        numJellyBeans=273
        weight=158.052
        availableColors=[red,blue,yellow,green]
        # Properties of this batch of jelly beans
        properties={
           lotNumber=29474936
           texture=shiny
           flavor=fruity
           metadata=10 1F BE A2 50 00 22 3A FF
        }
        java code:
        DaTextElement docRoot = DaTextParser.parse(new File("ex.dtx"));
        int n = docRoot.getInt("numJellyBeans");
        System.out.println("There are " + n + " jelly beans");

        Parameters:
        key - Variable name that identifies the element being referenced.
        Returns:
        Returns the text value of the indicated field, or null if no such element exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the indicated element is not a element type.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - Thrown if the field could not be parsed as a number (may be due to locale mismatch)

        System.out.println("Mass: " + grams + "g");

      • getBinary

        public abstract byte[] getBinary(java.lang.String key)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Gets a field by the given field name, if it exists, and parses it as an array of bytes. The bytes are given as a stream of hexadecimal numbers read 2 at a time (whitespace is optional).

        Example:
        ex.dtx:
        numJellyBeans=273
        weight=158.052
        availableColors=[red,blue,yellow,green]
        # Properties of this batch of jelly beans
        properties={
           lotNumber=29474936
           texture=shiny
           flavor=fruity
           metadata=10 1F BE A2 50 00 22 3A FF
        }
        java code:
        DaTextElement docRoot = DaTextParser.parse(new File("ex.dtx"));
        long lot = docRoot.getElement("properties").getLong("lotNumber");
        System.out.println("Analyzing lot #" + lot);

        Parameters:
        key - Variable name that identifies the element being referenced.
        Returns:
        Returns a DaTextElement representing the indicated element, or null if no such element exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the indicated element is not an element type.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - Thrown if the hexadecimal stream is not well-formatted

      • getOrSetElement

        public abstract DaTextElement getOrSetElement(java.lang.String key)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the child element by the given element name, if it exists, or adds a new element if it doesn't already exist.

        Example:
        ex.dtx:
        numJellyBeans=273
        weight=158.052
        availableColors=[red,blue,yellow,green]
        # Properties of this batch of jelly beans
        properties={
           lotNumber=29474936
           texture=shiny
           flavor=fruity
           metadata=10 1F BE A2 50 00 22 3A FF
        }
        java code:
        DaTextElement docRoot = DaTextParser.parse(new File("ex.dtx"));
        String title = docRoot.getOrSetElement("label").getOrSetText("title", "Magical Beans");
        System.out.println("Title: " + title);

        Parameters:
        key - Variable name that identifies the element being referenced.
        Returns:
        Returns the element, if it exists, or the newly created one (with default value) it it didn't exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the indicated element exists and is not an element type.

      • getOrSetList

        public abstract java.util.List<java.lang.String> getOrSetList(java.lang.String key,
                                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> defaultValue)
                                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets a field by the given field name, if it exists, or adds a new one if it doesn't already exist.

        Example:
        ex.dtx:
        numJellyBeans=273
        weight=158.052
        availableColors=[red,blue,yellow,green]
        # Properties of this batch of jelly beans
        properties={
           lotNumber=29474936
           texture=shiny
           flavor=fruity
           metadata=10 1F BE A2 50 00 22 3A FF
        }
        java code:
        DaTextElement docRoot = DaTextParser.parse(new File("ex.dtx"));
        List<String> reviews = docRoot.getOrSetElement("label").getOrSetList("reviews", defaultReviews);
        for(String s : reviews){
          System.out.println(s + "!");
        }

        Parameters:
        key - Variable name that identifies the element being referenced.
        defaultValue - The value to initialize the field to if is doesn't already exist (ignored if it does already exist).
        Returns:
        Returns the referenced field, if it exists, or the newly created one (with the provided default value) it it didn't exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the indicated element exists but is not the correct type.

      • getOrSetBinary

        public abstract byte[] getOrSetBinary(java.lang.String key,
                    byte[] defaultValue)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Gets a field by the given field name, if it exists, or adds a new one if it doesn't already exist.

        Example:
        ex.dtx:
        numJellyBeans=273
        weight=158.052
        availableColors=[red,blue,yellow,green]
        # Properties of this batch of jelly beans
        properties={
           lotNumber=29474936
           texture=shiny
           flavor=fruity
           metadata=10 1F BE A2 50 00 22 3A FF
        }
        java code:
        DaTextElement docRoot = DaTextParser.parse(new File("ex.dtx"));
        ByteArrayOutputStream stream = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
        ImageIO.write(newLabelImg, "png", stream);
        byte[] imageStream = docRoot.getOrSetElement("label").getOrSetBinary("icon", stream.toByteArray());

        Parameters:
        key - Variable name that identifies the element being referenced.
        defaultValue - The value to initialize the field to if is doesn't already exist (ignored if it does already exist).
        Returns:
        Returns the referenced field, if it exists, or the newly created one (with the provided default value) it it didn't exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the indicated field exists but is not the correct type.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - Thrown if the indicated field exists but is not correctly formatted.

      • putElement

        public abstract void putElement(java.lang.String key)
        Adds a new child element to this element, overwriting any pre-existing field or element with the same name.
        Parameters:
        key - Name of the element for use in the corresponding get method.

      • putCopyOf

        public abstract void putCopyOf(java.lang.String key,
             DaTextElement other)
        Clones the other element and adds it to this element.
        Parameters:
        key - Name of the element for use in the corresponding get method.
        other - Element to clone and add.

      • putValue

        public abstract void putValue(java.lang.String key,
            java.util.List value)
        Stores a value in this element, overwriting any previous element or value that may have previously been stored under the same field name.
        Parameters:
        key - Name of the field for use in the corresponding get method.
        value - Value to store

      • remove

        public abstract void remove(java.lang.String key)
        Deletes a stored field or element.
        Parameters:
        key - Name of the field or element to remove.

      • getChildElements

        public abstract java.util.List<DaTextElement> getChildElements()
        Enumerates all child elements of this element. If there are no child elements, an empty list must be returned.
        Returns:
        A list of all child elements (list will have size of 0 if there are no child elements). Fields are not included in this list.

      • clone

        public abstract DaTextElement clone()
        Implementations must override the clonde() method to perform a deep copy, treating the copy at the root of a new tree.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A copy of this element that is an independant root whose children elements and fields are all copies of the those of this element.
